description: No subject matter jurisdiction - incomplete diversity
facts: New York plaintiff sues two defendants for breach of contract
One defendant is a citizen of California
Other defendant is a citizen of New York
Lawsuit filed in federal district court
asp_facts: claim(c1). claim_type(c1, subject_matter_jurisdiction). plaintiff(c1, ny_plaintiff). defendant(c1, multiparty). forum(c1, federal_court). plaintiff_state(c1, new_york). defendant1_state(c1, california). defendant2_state(c1, new_york). complete_diversity(c1, no). amount_in_controversy(c1, 500000). federal_question(c1, no). state_law_claim(c1, yes).
question: Does the federal court have subject matter jurisdiction?
rationale: Diversity jurisdiction requires complete diversity between all plaintiffs and all defendants. Here, the New York plaintiff and one New York defendant destroy complete diversity. With no federal question involved, federal court lacks subject matter jurisdiction.
